skills.name: Complete a symmetric figure with respect to a specific line of symmetry
Identify or mark lines of symmetry on a shape

explanations.A: Remember that a line of symmetry cuts a shape in to two parts, where one part is a mirror image of the other.
explanations.B: Make sure that you consider both horizontal and vertical lines of symmetry.
explanations.C: This shape has 2 lines of symmetry; one vertical and one horizontal.
explanations.D: I think you might have included diagonal lines of symmetry. However, this shape is a rectangle so the diagonals are not lines of symmetry.

explanations.A: Try marking on the lines of symmetry to make sure you have counted each line
explanations.B: Pick a vertex (corner) and draw a line through it so that it also cuts the side opposite in two. This is one line of symmetry. Because the shape is a regular pentagon, there are 5 vertices through which similar lines can be drawn. This means there are 5 lines of symmetry.
explanations.C: There is one going straight down the middle of the shape, but there are some more.
explanations.D: Think about where you could fold the shape in half so that it matches exactly.
